remarks: Three points are colinear iff there is a line through all three of them.  Theorem 6.23 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 28-May-2019.)
statement:
tglineintmo.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
colline.1 $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
colline.2 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
colline.3 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
colline.4 $e |- ( ph -> 2 <_ ( # ` P ) ) $.
colline $p |- ( ph -> ( ( X e. ( Y L Z ) \/ Y = Z ) <-> E. a e. ran L ( X e. a /\ Y e. a /\ Z e. a ) ) ) $.
$d L a $.
$d X a $.
$d Y a $.
$d Z a $.
$d a ph $.
